about.summary: I'm Pablo, a physical engineer venturing into data engineering and software development, passionate about building scalable and efficient solutions. With a solid foundation in data storage, ETL processes, and programming concepts, I'm eager to contribute to innovative projects and continue to grow professionally.
about.professionalProfile: Jr. Data Engineer with experience in the design and development of ETL/ELT pipelines using technologies such as GCP, AWS, and Airflow. I have achieved significant reductions in load times (up to 40%) and automated delta and full-load ingestions. Additionally, I have deployed containers for ETL web scraping, which has reduced latency by 60%. I have also implemented Machine Learning and Optical Character Recognition (OCR) solutions, achieving 90% accuracy in segmentation (SAM) and text extraction (AWS Textract) tasks. My experience includes the application of agile methodologies such as Scrum and the use of efficiency and stability metrics such as OEE, Cp, and Cpk in industrial environments and advanced analytics processes, including quality management (QA/QC) under ISO/IEC 17025 and INACAL standards.

education.degree: B.Sc. with a major in Physical Engineering
education.institution: Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería, Rímac - Lima - Perú
education.details: Final project involved simulating energy consumption for heating an Experimental Housing Module located at 4500 masl. The temperature predictions are compared with recorded indoor temperatures to validate the model. The target indoor temperature is then calculated. Finally, the energy required to maintain a neutral indoor temperature is calculated.

publications.title: Simulation of Energy Consumption for the Heating of an Experimental Housing Module Located at 4500 masl

experience.description:
- I designed data infrastructure on GCP using Terraform and JSON.
- I automated stored procedures and DAGs in Airflow, reducing load times by 40%.
- I managed reprocessing from Oracle to BigQuery with 100% consistency.
- I developed pipelines on AWS with PySpark to generate scalable final tables.
- I deployed a Docker container (Linux + PostgreSQL) for ETL web scraping, normalizing logs and reducing latency by 60%.
- I implemented modular ML architecture (CLIP, OCR, segmentation, validation) with 90% accuracy.

- I implemented OEE KPIs to measure efficiency on four packaging lines.
- I applied CP and CPK to assess process variability and stability.
- I transformed plant indicators into structured datasets (ETL, SQL Server).
- I calibrated tanks and sensors, ensuring metrological traceability.
- I defined reprocessing limits to optimize fermentation and reduce waste.

- I developed a management system that centralizes clients, equipment, and certificates, with cloud storage and data governance, reducing service time by 60%.
- I analyzed results using data-driven decisions.
- I coordinated external field calibration providers.
- I collaborated with QA/QC to improve the laboratory's management system.
- I supported documentation for ISO/IEC 17025 accreditation.

projects.title: Voucher Processing with OCR and Machine Learning
projects.description: I designed a Python application that processes voucher images (or receipts) through a pipeline that includes segmenting the vouchers within a larger image, validating whether the segments are actually vouchers and extracting text using OCR.

projects.title: Data Analysis and Modeling for Solar Radiation Prediction
projects.description: Data analysis and modeling project to predict hourly solar radiation over a given time horizon. This project involves data exploration, data preprocessing and cleaning, and training a machine learning model to perform the prediction.

projects.title: ETL/ELT Pipeline: Web Data Ingestion and Normalization
projects.description: I developed an ETL/ELT pipeline for web data ingestion (web scraping), optimizing the extraction and normalization process. I used technologies such as Python and PostgreSQL for data logic and Docker for containerization and deployment in a Linux environment. The project managed to normalize daily logs and reduce processing latency by 60%.

tools.name: Project management tools: Slack, Microsoft Teams, Jira, Trello
Version control: Git, GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket
Cloud, CI/CD & Orchestration: GCP, AWS, Apache Airflow, Terraform (IaC)
Data analysis & visualization tools: Microsoft Excel, Power BI, Looker Studio

concepts.name: Project management and agile methodologies: Scrum, Kanban, Design Thinking, Lean mindset, PMBOK
Machine Learning & Computer Vision: CLIP, SAM, AWS Textract, OCR
Quality & efficiency metrics: OEE, Cp, Cpk
